text:
Brian Austin Green Net Worth and Salary: Brian Austin Green is an American actor who has a net worth of $10 million dollars. That is a combined net worth with his on-again-off-again-currently-on-again wife, Megan Fox. Born July 15, 1973 in Van Nuys, California, Brian Austin Green is best known for his role as David Silver on the television series Beverly Hills, 90210. Prior to his role on Beverly Hills, 90210, Green had a recurring role on the hit CBS prime time soap opera Knots Landing, playing the role of Brian Cunningham. He has also starred as a series regular in Terminator: The Sarah Conner Chronicles, Freddie, Wedding Band and Anger Management. He also guest-starred on Smallville and Desperate Housewives, as well as other television shows. Green appeared briefly in the multiple award-winning Showtime drama series Resurrection Blvd. and had a cameo on Hope & Faith, where he met Megan Fox and they started dating in 2004. In 2010, Green married actress Megan Fox. In March 2012, TMZ.com reported that celebrity photographer Delbert Shaw filed a lawsuit against Green and wife Megan Fox in Los Angeles County Superior Court for allegedly assaulting him after the took photographs of the couple while on vacation in Hawaii in 2010. In June 2012, Green claimed he was defending himself against Shaw and that his wife should not be named in the lawsuit. In August 2012 it was reported that Brian Austin Green and Megan Fox were divorcing. As of this writing, they are still legally married. In April 2019 Megan moved to dismiss the divorce proceedings. The couple has three children together.

After appearing in 292 episodes of the original Beverly Hills 90210, in August 2019 Brian returned to television as a star and co-producer of the re-booted BH90210.

Brian Austin Green Real Estate: In 2009 they bought a home in the Los Feliz neighborhood of Los Angeles for $2.95 million. They sold this house in 2014 for $3.75 million. As part of their decoupling process, in February of 2016 Brian and Megan began selling some of their real estate assets. They sold one Los Angeles home for $2.6 million and another for $1.299 million. In May 2016 Megan and Brian spent $3.3 million on a 2-acre property in Malibu. The seller was Brad Pitt's manager Cynthia Pett-Dante (wife of comedic actor Peter Dante). In 2018, Megan sued Cynthia for $5 million alleging the seller failed to disclose a serious mold problem in the house.
